channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bank of America tells junior execs to blow the whistle on managers who overwork them
item.description: Managers reportedly told employees to downplay how much they were working to avoid triggering an HR policy.

item.title: Inflation reports clear way for Fed to cut, but how much is still the question
item.description: Markets now expect a better chance for a quarter percentage point cut in September, but are still leaving the door open.

item.title: Eli Lilly helps put pharmaceuticals ETF on track for highest close ever
Schumer joins growing chorus of pro-crypto Democrats—but Harris keeps silent for now
item.description: A new grassroots organization is trying to stop the Trump crypto wave by hosting a town hall with top politicians and industry leaders.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Brinker, Victoria's Secret, Flutter Entertainment and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Toward the power grid of the future: a Barron’s roundtable — sign up today
Medical care and prescription costs among top 10 worries of older adults before 2024 election
item.description: Adults over 50 are a key demographic for candidates this election cycle.

item.title: Here's the inflation breakdown for July 2024 — in one chart
item.description: The consumer price index has risen 2.9% since July 2023, the lowest annual reading since March 2021.

item.title: Dow industrials expand intraday gain to 200 points — live coverage
Inflation drops to 3-year low, sealing the deal for Fed to cut rates in September
item.description: Consumer prices rose just 0.2% from June to July and 2.9% on an annualized basis—the smallest increase since early 2021.

item.title: Dip buyers vindicated as CPI report revives economic 'soft landing' scenario
item.description: The big worry for the market was a growth slowdown, but continued relief on inflation is the market story this week.

item.title: Social Security’s annual cost-of-living adjustment seen shrinking next year
Reporter caught using artificial intelligence to create fake stories and quotes
item.description: Aaron Pelczar, a 40-year-old who was new to journalism, admitted he had used AI in his stories before he resigned from Wyoming's Cody Enterprise.

item.title: Britain considers tougher internet safety laws after riots, Musk comments — what you need to know
item.description: The U.K. is considering ways to toughen up internet safety regulations after far-right riots sparked by misinformation and incendiary comments from Elon Musk.

item.title: Big-picture view of CPI: U.S. inflation continues to cool. But hot spots remain.
